metadata.title: CVE-2013-0213 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Samba Web Administration Tool (SWAT) in Samba 3.x before 3.5.21, 3.6.xbefore 3.6.12, and 4.x before 4.0.2 allows remote attackers to conductclickjacking attacks via a (1) FRAME or (2) IFRAME element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
libpam-smbpass - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
python-samba - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
samba - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
winbind - 2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.6.15-1ubuntu1').
